meanings.definition: A disappointing end to an exciting or impressive series of events.
meanings.sent1: The movie's anticlimaxes left the audience feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent2: The anticlimaxes of the fireworks show disappointed the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The anticlimaxes of the magic trick made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The anticlimaxes of the race felt like a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The anticlimaxes of the party were like a sudden rain on a sunny day.

meanings.definition: A letdown or disappointment after a build-up of excitement.
meanings.sent1: The anticlimaxes of the roller coaster ride were unexpected.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing anticlimaxes after a thrilling build-up can be disheartening.
meanings.sent3: The anticlimaxes of the surprise party were amusingly awkward.
meanings.sent4: The anticlimaxes of the concert felt like a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The anticlimaxes of the game were etched in everyone's memory.
